description: President Biden on Sunday announced he is not running for reelection and endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris for the nomination.
title: Trump says he thinks Harris is "no better" than Biden in 2024 matchup

description: An intensified focus on women's health and abortion could help galvanize Democratic voters in the final sprint to the election.
title: Kamala Harris expected to take outspoken approach on health policy

description: CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane reports on Democratic lawmakers and others who are throwing their support behind Vice President Kamala Harris following President Biden's decision to end his campaign. And Democratic strategist Joel Payne joined CBS News to discuss some of the mechanics at play inside the party.
title: Mass of congressional Democrats giving endorsements to Vice President Harris

description: CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has new reporting on what led to President Biden's decision to end his reelection campaign and what happened after Biden's announcement.
title: New details on what led to Biden's decision to end campaign

description: Rep. Adam Smith, the ranking Democrat on the House Armed Services Committee, told CBS News that the potential elevation of Vice President Kamala Harris to the top of the Democratic ticket "jolts the campaign in a way that it needs to be jolted" following President Biden's decision to end his reelection bid.
title: Rep. Adam Smith says Vice President Harris at top of ticket shoots jolt of life into campaign

description: Republican strategist Terry Sullivan and Democratic strategist Joel Payne joined CBS News to react to President Biden's decision to end his reelection campaign and the potential matchup between Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump.
title: GOP, Democratic strategists on potential Harris-Trump matchup, Biden decision to drop out

description: Former President Donald Trump posted on social media Sunday that, in the wake of President Biden's decision to leave the 2024 race, this fall's presidential debate should be on Fox News instead of ABC. Norah O'Donnell anchored CBS News' ongoing special report on Biden's decision to end his reelection campaign.
title: Trump says next debate should be on Fox News instead of ABC after Biden drops out

description: Sen. Peter Welch, a Democrat from Vermont who had called on President Biden to leave the 2024 race, said he's not endorsing any candidate right now when asked if he would back Vice President Harris for the White House. Biden announced Sunday he's ending his reelection campaign.
title: Sen. Peter Welch declines to endorse Harris, reacts to Biden decision

description: One of President Biden's two younger brothers, Frank Biden, said in his opinion the president's health "absolutely" played a role in his decision to end his 2024 campaign. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes has more.
title: Biden's brother says president's health played role in decision to end campaign

description: Former President Barack Obama's statement on President Biden's decision to end his reelection campaign noticeably didn't include an endorsement for Vice President Kamala Harris. CBS News' Norah O'Donnell, Robert Costa, Ed O'Keefe, John Dickerson and Margaret Brennan have more on that.
title: Obama not yet endorsing Vice President Harris after Biden decision to drop out

description: President Biden announced Sunday he is ending his reelection campaign and endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris for the Oval Office. Norah O'Donnell anchored CBS News' special report.
title: What we know about Biden's decision to end reelection campaign | Special Report

description: Key progressive and member of "The Squad" Minnesota Rep. Ilhan Omar endorsed Kamala Harris for president on Sunday after President Biden announced he was dropping out of the 2024 presidential race.
title: Rep. Ilhan Omar, other members of "The Squad" endorse Kamala Harris for president

description: Rep. Jim Himes, the ranking Democrat on the House Intelligence Committee, called for President Biden to drop out of the 2024 presidential race following Biden's NATO press conference. He joined CBS News to discuss Biden's Sunday decision to end his reelection bid.
title: Rep. Jim Himes on Biden decision to end campaign

description: Former President Donald Trump spoke by phone with CBS News' Robert Costa about President Biden's decision to end his reelection campaign. Trump called it a shock to the country and that he wasn't sure if Vice President Kamala Harris would be the Democratic nominee.
title: Trump reacts to Biden decision to end reelection campaign

description: President Biden's decision to end his reelection campaign leads to questions about election law and the ability for the Democratic Party's nominee to appear on ballots in all 50 states. David Becker, executive director of the Center for Election Innovation and Research, joined CBS News to talk about that.
title: How do election laws come into play after Biden's decision to drop out?

description: Democrats and Republicans in Congress are voicing their opinions on President Biden's decision to end his reelection campaign, with several Democrats endorsing Vice President Harris and Republicans like House Speaker Mike Johnson calling for Biden to resign. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane has more.
title: Congressional Republicans bash Biden withdrawal from 2024 race

description: Vice President Kamala Harris said she would do everything in her power to unite the Democratic Party and the country in her effort to defeat former President Donald Trump after President Biden decided to end his reelection campaign and endorse Harris for the White House. CBS News' Nancy Cordes, Ed O'Keefe, Robert Costa and Margaret Brennan have more.
title: Kamala Harris statement on Biden decision to end reelection campaign

description: Vice President Kamala Harris said in a statement that it is her "intention is to earn and win" the Democratic presidential nomination.
title: Kamala Harris says she intends to "earn and win" Democratic presidential nomination

description: President Biden's decision to end his reelection campaign is a historic one for many reasons. CBS News' Robert Costa has more on that.
title: How Biden's decision to end campaign measures historically

description: Bill and Hillary Clinton were among the Democrats who endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris after President Biden ended his reelection bid Sunday.
title: Democrats line up behind Kamala Harris after Biden drops reelection bid

description: After President Biden announced Sunday he would not continue to seek reelection, leaders from across the globe shared their responses to his decision.
title: Foreign leaders react to Biden's decision not to seek reelection

description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar, a Democrat from Minnesota, joined CBS News to share her thoughts on President Biden's historic decision to end his reelection campaign and endorse Vice President Kamala Harris for the White House.
title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar on Biden decision to end campaign

description: Former President Barack Obama and others are reacting to President Biden's decision to end his 2024 campaign and endorse Vice President Harris for president. CBS News' Norah O'Donnell, Robert Costa, Ed O'Keefe and Margaret Brennan have more.
title: Obama, Trump Jr., others react to Biden dropping out of 2024 election

description: Former President Barack Obama did not endorse Vice President Kamala Harris, saying the Democratic Party "will be navigating uncharted waters in the days ahead,
title: Obama says Democrats in "uncharted waters" after Biden withdraws

description: Former President Barack Obama released a statement about President Biden's decision​ to drop out of the 2024 presidential race. Notably, Obama did not name or endorse Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: Read Obama's full statement on Biden dropping out

description: Sen. Chris Coons, who serves President Biden's home state of Delaware, got choked up while speaking about the president's connection to the state. Coons called Biden, "The greatest Delawarian in our history."
title: Sen. Chris Coons gets emotional speaking about Biden's decision to end 2024 campaign

description: Sen. Chris Coons, from President Biden's home state of Delaware, joined CBS News to react to President Biden's historic decision to end his reelection campaign.
title: Sen. Chris Coons on Biden's legacy, decision to drop out of 2024 race

description: On this "Face the Nation" broadcast, Sen. Joe Manchin and Biden campaign co-chair Cedric Richmond join Margaret Brennan.
title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation," July 21, 2024

description: Potential running mates for Kamala Harris are already popping up after President Biden announced he would end his reelection bid and throw his support behind his vice president. CBS News' Norah O'Donnell, Ed O'Keefe, Robert Costa and Margaret Brennan have more.
title: Who could be Kamala Harris' running mate?

description: President Biden announced Sunday he's ending his 2024 reelection run and endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris for the White House. CBS News' Robert Costa, Ed O'Keefe and Margaret Brennan have more on what the road ahead looks like for Harris and Democrats.
title: What the road forward looks like for Kamala Harris, Democrats, after Biden ends campaign

description: President Biden has announced he's ending his reelection campaign and endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris for the Democratic Party's presidential nomination. CBS News' Margaret Brennan, Robert Costa, Willie James Inman and Nancy Cordes have more on the decision and the idea that Harris could face challengers from within her party.
title: Possible Democratic challengers to Kamala Harris say they're standing down

description: President Biden has announced he will end his reelection bid, endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris to be the Democratic Party's nominee to go against former President Donald Trump in November. CBS News chief foreign affairs correspondent Margaret Brennan, CBS News chief election, campaign correspondent Robert Costa and CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes have more on what this does to the presidential race.
title: What Biden's withdrawal does to presidential race

description: Here's how Republican Senators and members of Congress are reacting to the president's decision to leave the race just weeks before the Democratic Convention.
title: GOP lawmakers react to Biden's decision to leave presidential race

description: President Biden is ending his reelection campaign and has thrown his support behind Vice President Kamala Harris, endorsing her for the Democratic Party's presidential nomination. CBS News political contributor Joel Payne has more on that.
title: Will Democrats get behind Vice President Kamala Harris?

description: Shortly after the announcement, President Biden endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: Who could replace Joe Biden as the 2024 Democratic nominee?

description: President Biden announced Sunday he is dropping his reelection bid in the 2024 presidential race and endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: Biden's decision to drop out upends presidential race

description: President Biden made a historic announcement Sunday, deciding to end his reelection campaign and endorse Vice President Kamala Harris for president. CBS News' Nancy Cordes and Willie James Inman along with BET anchor Ed Gordon, who interviewed Biden this past week, discuss the president's decision.
title: What led to Biden dropping out of presidential race, endorsing Kamala Harris

description: President Biden announced his decision to withdraw from the 2024 presidential race in a letter addressing the American people. Read it here.
title: Read Biden's letter announcing his withdrawal from the presidential race

description: President Biden announced Sunday that he is dropping out of the 2024 presidential race and endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris to be the Democratic Party's nominee. Kristine Johnson anchored a CBS News Special Report.
title: President Biden dropping out of 2024 presidential race | Special Report

description: President Biden announced Sunday that he's ending his reelection campaign and endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris to be the Democratic Party's nominee. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes and CBS News senior White House and political correspondent Ed O'Keefe have more on that.
title: Biden endorses Kamala Harris for president after dropping out of 2024 race

description: President Biden endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris to be the Democratic presidential nominee.
title: What to know about Kamala Harris, top contender for Democratic nominee

description: Cedric Richmond, the co-chair of President Biden's reelection campaign, tells "Face the Nation" that the president "has heard those concerns" of prominent Democrats and lawmakers who have called on him to drop out of the 2024 race, but "he's made a decision" to stay in the race. "I think that there are those out there that need to hear it again, that he made a decision, he's going to be the candidate, he's going to be the next president," Richmond added.
title: Biden campaign co-chair Cedric Richmond says president "has heard those concerns" of Democrats

description: Former National Security Council official Fiona Hill tells "Face the Nation" that the rhetoric at the Republican National Convention "projects to the rest of the world that the United States is no different from any other country where you're getting a populist leader emerging," while author Robert Kagan says what Republican vice-presidential candidate JD Vance is offering is " not new" but rather "to the fundamental principles that the founders established.
title: Fiona Hill says RNC rhetoric shows U.S. "is no different" from countries with populist movement

description: Biden is the first sitting president to drop out of running for reelection since Lyndon B. Johnson in 1968 — leaving the race against Donald Trump in turmoil.
title: Biden drops out of the 2024 presidential race

description: Rep. Dean Phillips, the Minnesota Democrat who challenged President Biden for the presidential nomination and ultimately endorsed him, tells "Face the Nation" that "it is time to step aside and turn this over to a new generation." Phillips added that Mr. Biden "does not" have the confidence of Congress, and he is calling this week for a "secret ballot expeditiously, when we're back here this week, to present privately to the president to show him where Congress stands."
title: Rep. Dean Phillips says President Biden "does not" have Congress' confidence, should drop out

description: This week on "Face the Nation," as Americans take stock of the tumultuous political moment they are living through, Margaret Brennan speaks to key Democrats Sen. Joe Manchin and Rep. Dean Phillips, who both joined the growing chorus of Democratic lawmakers calling on President Biden to step aside in the 2024 race. Plus, Biden campaign co-chair Cedric Richmond joins, along with House Intelligence Committee chairman Rep. Mike Turner.
title: 7/21: Face the Nation

description: Missed the second half of the show? The latest on calls for Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 election.
title: Face The Nation: Phillips, Richmond, Hill

description: The Israeli airstrikes were the first time Israel is known to have responded to repeated Houthi attacks throughout its nine-month war against Hamas.
title: Israel stops missile fired from Yemen after Israeli strike on Houthi rebels

description: Rep. Mike Turner repeated his calls for Secret Service director Kimberly Cheatle to resign, telling "Face the Nation" that if former President Donald Trump had been killed in the rally shooting, the Secret Service "would be culpable." "Every aspect of their failure leads right to giving an opportunity to shoot Donald Trump," Turner said.
title: Rep. Mike Turner says that if Trump had been killed, Secret Service "would be culpable"

description: Sen. Joe Manchin of West Virginia, a longtime Democrat recently turned independent, tells "Face the Nation" that President Biden should step aside in the 2024 race. "I'm just very hopeful that this torch is passed to a new generation to allow President Biden be the president I know he is and can be," Manchin said.
title: Sen. Joe Manchin calls on President Biden to drop out of 2024 race

description: Guest host: Mo Rocca. In our cover story, Robert Costa looks at an unconventional week in the 2024 presidential race. Plus: Tracy Smith talks with doctors and activists working to help children wounded by the fighting in the Gaza Strip; Ted Koppel meets 90-year-old track star Florence Meiler, training for the decathlon; Jim Axelrod sits down with Bruce Springsteen to explore the creation of his classic 1982 album, “Nebraska”; Faith Salie goes in search of the secrets of elephants; Seth Doane profiles sculptor Jacopo Cardillo; and Josh Seftel talks with his mother, Pat, about her summer plans.
title: 7/21: Sunday Morning

description: This week on "Face the Nation," as Americans take stock of the tumultuous political moment they are living through, Margaret Brennan speaks to key Democrats Sen. Joe Manchin and Rep. Dean Phillips, who both joined the growing chorus of Democratic lawmakers calling on President Biden to step aside in the 2024 race. Plus, Biden campaign co-chair Cedric Richmond joins, along with House Intelligence Committee chairman Rep. Mike Turner.
title: Open: This is "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," July 21, 2024

description: "The crews of the Russian fighters identified the aerial target as a pair of U.S. Air Force B-52H strategic bombers," Moscow's defense ministry wrote.
title: Russia says its fighter jets intercepted U.S. bombers in the Arctic

description: It was the third vehicle crash into a state police cruiser within 48 hours, according to police reports.
title: Maine state trooper injured after cruiser rear-ended during traffic stop

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Biden campaign co-chair Cedric Richmond on "Face the Nation" that aired on July 21, 2024.
title: Transcript: Biden campaign co-chair Cedric Richmond on "Face the Nation," July 21, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with House Intelligence Committee chairman Rep. Mike Turner, Republican of Ohio, on "Face the Nation" that aired on July 21, 2024.
title: Transcript: House Intelligence Committee chairman Mike Turner on "Face the Nation," July 21, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Rep. Dean Phillips, Democrat of Minneosta, on "Face the Nation" that aired on July 21, 2024.
title: Transcript: Rep. Dean Phillips on "Face the Nation," July 21, 2024

description: Utah State cornerback and former Belleville High School football star Andre Seldon Jr. died Saturday in an apparent drowning at a Utah reservoir, the school announced.
title: Andre Seldon Jr., Utah State football player and former Belleville High School star, dies in apparent drowning

description: The third Sunday in July is marked as the day to celebrate our favorite frozen dessert. Watch these "Sundae Morning" stories about the treat we're all screaming about!
title: Get the scoop on National Ice Cream Day!

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Sen. Joe Manchin, Democrat of West Virginia, on "Face the Nation" that aired on July 21, 2024.
title: Transcript: Sen. Joe Manchin on "Face the Nation," July 21, 2024

description: Sen. Joe Manchin on Sunday joined a growing pool of lawmakers calling on President Biden to end his reelection campaign.
title: Manchin calls on Biden to step aside in 2024, "leave with a legacy unmatched"

description: Detectives are currently talking to the man as the investigation continues.
title: Woman stabbed at MIA, almost thrown over balcony; man arrested

description: John Dickerson on how the Republican National Convention provided little drama this year, as party faithful paid homage to their nominee Donald Trump (whose acceptance speech praised, of all things, a fictional cannibal).
title: The GOP's one-man show, starring Donald Trump

description: The Republican National Convention provided little drama this year, as party faithful paid homage to their nominee, former President Donald Trump. CBS News correspondent John Dickerson, anchor of "The Daily Report," reflects on the role the RNC is playing in this year's presidential race rematch.
title: The GOP's one-man show, starring Donald Trump

description: "Sunday Morning" contributor Josh Seftel talks with his mother, Pat, about her summer plans.
title: Josh Seftel's mom on summer

description: The Pope stressed that sport also has "a great social power, capable of peacefully uniting people from different cultures."
title: Pope Francis calls for Olympic truce for countries at war

description: An album of dark songs recorded in a bedroom at his rented farmhouse in 1982, reflecting the upheaval in his life in-between "The River" and "Born in the U.S.A.," helped solidify Springsteen's status as one of music's most soulful voices.
title: Bruce Springsteen on the poetry of his classic album "Nebraska"

description: In-between his chart-topping album "The River" and his classic "Born in the U.S.A.," Bruce Springsteen recorded a collection of songs on a 4-track cassette recorder in a bedroom at his rented farmhouse – dark, mournful, and rough-hewn songs that reflected the upheaval in his life at a time of rising success. The resulting album, 1982's "Nebraska," would be one of his most personal, and helped solidify his status as one of music's most soulful voices. Springsteen talks with correspondent Jim Axelrod about how "Nebraska" spoke to his evolution as a songwriter. Axelrod also talks with Warren Zanes, author of the new book, "Deliver Me from Nowhere: The Making of Bruce Springsteen's 'Nebraska'." (This story was originally broadcast on April 30, 2023.)
title: Bruce Springsteen on the soulful voice behind "Nebraska"

description: We leave you this Sunday on the Plover River in Steven's Point, Wisconsin. Videographer: Scot Miller.
title: Nature: Wisconsin river views

description: There is a lot we're still learning about the magnificent elephant, a creature that became a political animal after satirist Thomas Nast used it in cartoons in the 1870s. Correspondent Faith Salie visits the exhibition "The Secret World of Elephants," at the American Museum of Natural History in New York, and checks out the pachyderms at the National Zoo in Washington, D.C., to uncover some of the elephant's secrets, from its means of communication, to its trunk, "the Swiss army knife of organs."
title: Secrets of the elephant

description: Doctors and aid workers describe desperate conditions in the Gaza Strip since Israel responded to Hamas' attack last October, and their efforts to rescue children, the most vulnerable victims of violence.
title: Children of Gaza

description: The Palestine Children's Relief Fund has helped rescue more than 200 children from Gaza who are in need of medical treatment, including two-year-old Jood Damo, who was injured by an Israeli airstrike. Correspondent Tracy Smith talks with doctors about conditions in the Gaza Strip ever since Israel responded to Hamas' attack last October, and how children have become the overwhelming victims of violence. (Warning: Contains disturbing images.)
title: Children of Gaza

description: Bob Newhart, whose observational humor and deadpan delivery were featured in classic standup comedy albums and two hit TV sitcoms, died on July 18, 2024, at the age of 94. Correspondent Mo Rocca looks back at the career of a comedy legend.
title: Passage: Remembering Bob Newhart, master of the deadpan

description: One Olympic sport that has not been open to women is the 10-event decathlon, whose winner is crowned "world's greatest athlete." (Women instead compete in the seven-event heptathlon.) But there are women athletes, young and older, who would like to see that changed. "Sunday Morning" senior contributor Ted Koppel meets Florence Meiler, a 90-year-old track star training for the USA Masters Combined Events Championship in Charlottesville, Va.; and with Lauren Kuntz and Sophie Knudson, decathletes who are part of a growing movement to overcome the one hurdle that keeps women from competing in the decathlon in international competition.
title: Meet 90-year-old track star Florence Meiler

description: Thirty-seven-year-old sculptor Jacopo Cardillo, better known in his native Italy as Jago, has earned a following with his contemporary approach to this classical art form, exposing on social media his process of shaping marble. When he embraced a group of teens who'd defaced one of his works, Jago won a new fan touched by his humanity: Whoopi Goldberg. Correspondent Seth Doane talked with the artist about his most ambitious project yet: creating what will be a 6-ton sculpture more than 16 feet tall.
title: Rock star: Sculptor Jago on unveiling humankind in marble

description: The real impact of the Republican National Convention - where wrestling stars and former critics came to honor former President Donald Trump - is up for debate. At the same time, President Joe Biden continued to resist calls from some Democrats and donors to drop out.
title: An unconventional week in presidential politics

description: Helicopters and airplanes were dropping buckets over the flames as ground crews tried to contain the fire on Ensign Peak in Salt Lake City.
title: Utah wildfire prompts mandatory evacuations

description: The impact of this past week's Republican National Convention - where wrestling stars and former critics came to honor former President Donald Trump, whose 1.5-hour acceptance speech dwelled on familiar grievances and left some attendees dozing - is up for debate. At the same time, President Joe Biden continued to resist calls from some Democrats and donors to drop out. CBS News chief election & campaign correspondent Robert Costa reports on signs of unity and disarray on the road to Election Day.
title: An unconventional week in presidential politics

description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at historical events on this date.
title: Almanac: July 21

description: Three people died and seven others were injured in a shooting at a large gathering early Sunday morning in the Carroll Park section of West Philadelphia, police said.
title: 3 dead, 7 injured in shooting in West Philadelphia, police say

description: Students, frustrated by shortages of good jobs, have been demanding an end to a quota that reserved 30% of government jobs for relatives of veterans who fought in Bangladesh's war of independence in 1971.
title: Bangladesh's top court scales back government jobs quota after unrest

description: Swimmer and Olympic gold medalist Katie Ledecky sits down with Elaine Quijano to discuss her memoir “Just Add Water: My Swimming Life” and the upcoming 2024 Olympic Games in Paris. Then, Kelefah Sanneh learns more about the poular sneaker brand New Balance. “Here Comes the Sun” is a closer look at some of the people, places and things we bring you every week on “CBS Sunday Morning.”
title: Here Comes the Sun: Katie Ledecky and more

description: Did a Florida man hire a look-a-like to kill his wife?  A GPS leads police right to the hit man’s door.  "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty reports.
title: The Plot to Kill Dr. Sievers

description: A young mother is dead and identical twin brothers are the suspects. Did studying TV crime shows help them come close to pulling off the perfect crime? "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty reports.
title: The Devil's Twin

description: Flyers still experiencing fallout from largest IT outage in history; How a pet cockatoo became a fixture in one Pennsylvania town
title: 7/20: CBS Weekend News

description: A big weekend of auto racing ends with the Verizon 200 at the Brickyard NASCAR Cup Series race today.
title: How to watch the Verizon 200 at The Brickyard NASCAR race

description: A popular doctor's brutal murder baffles investigators until digital clues lead to three unusual suspects.
title: Did a Florida man hire a look-alike to kill his wife?

description: Identical twin brothers are suspected of murdering a young mother – can investigators get one brother to turn on the other?
title: Will Colorado mom's killer get away with murder?

description: The sight of devastation and the smell of smoke remains outside First Baptist Dallas, one day after a four-alarm fire tore through the original sanctuary.
title: Members grieve massive fire which destroyed historic Dallas church sanctuary

description: CBS News has learned President Biden is deeply frustrated amid a push from within the Democratic Party to end his presidential bid. Some Democrats are supporting the president while pitching an alternative should he leave the race. Willie James Inman has the latest.
title: Pressure mounts as calls grow for Biden to end reelection bid

description: Travelers at airports across the globe were still facing long lines and flight cancellations as airlines Saturday struggled to recover from the CrowdStrike software meltdown. Elise Preston reports.
title: Flyers still experiencing fallout from largest IT outage in history

description: The U.S. Olympic and Paralympic Committee filed a federal lawsuit this week alleging Prime, Logan Paul's energy drink company, of infringing on the committee's trademarks.
title: Olympic Committee sues Logan Paul's energy drink brand over trademark
